repo.name: warren-bank
repo.description: This is an F-Droid repository of apps written by Warren Bank. All source code is GPL-2.0 and available on github: https://github.com/warren-bank?tab=repositories. All APK files are served by 301 redirect to a release asset within the corresponding github repository, and signed by its author with a key having the fingerprint: (SHA-1) 48b2fd2988b9358251b193e5eecac2e43298ef2d, (SHA-256) 7c2a9c3e54cff3cbe6f9f7293aeec465403b2350e03ff85cd0dd32a23d001cee.

application.name: ADB over WiFi
application.summary: Toggles Android Debug Bridge daemon (adbd) between USB and WiFi mode.
application.desc:
Requires root!
USB mode is the default. It requires a USB cable and USB drivers to connect the Android device to a computer.
WiFi mode is wireless and does not require any additional drivers. Any computer can use the "adb" client to request a connection to the Android device.
When WiFi mode is enabled, this app displays the "adb" command necessary to request such a connection over a LAN.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Bonjour WebRTC
application.summary: Make video calls between devices in a LAN.
application.desc:
mDNS (Bonjour) is used for the discovery of other available devices in a LAN. As such, no WebRTC signaling server is needed.
WebRTC is used for everything else.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Bookmarks
application.summary: Save Intents as an organized collection of bookmarks.
application.desc:
Background:
● an Android Intent can be used to open   a precise part of any installed   application, and pass to it any type   or quantity of data ● as such, an Intent is like an Android   bookmark
Features include the ability to:
● configure and save Intents as named   bookmarks ● use bookmarks to:   ○ start an Activity   ○ start a Service   ○ send a Broadcast ● schedule bookmarks to be used later:   ○ one time   ○ at an interval ● intercept Intents started by other   applications:   ○ to modify   ○ to save ● backup and restore:   ○ the entire SQLite database   ○ JSON data file   ○ Netscape Bookmark HTML data file
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: CLI Feedback
application.summary: Non-interactive utility to provide user feedback from the command line.
application.desc:
Types of user feedback:
● show a Toast ● show a Notification ● play an audio Ringtone
All types of user feedback are started by Intent. This utility can be used both by other applications, as well as directly by the user from a command line terminal emulator.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Droid-ify
application.summary: Material-ify with Droid-ify.
application.desc:
A quick material F-Droid client.
Features:
● Material F-Droid style ● No cards or inappropriate animations ● Fast repository syncing ● Standard Android components and   minimal dependencies
A direct adaptation/modification of Foxy-Droid.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: DroidPlay
application.summary: AirPlay (version 1) client for Android.
application.desc:
Features include:
● Automatic discovery of AirPlay   receivers within the same network ● Beam photos from your device to   AirPlay ● Stream videos and music from your   device to AirPlay ● Mirror the screen from your device to   AirPlay
Credits:
● DroidPlay     The original version of this     application.       https://github.com/tutikka/DroidPlay ● ScreenStream     Provided much of the code to     implement screen mirroring on     Android 5.0+       https://github.com/dkrivoruchko/ScreenStream/tree/1.2.7 ● AirPlay (version 1) protocol     Unofficial documentation.       http://nto.github.io/AirPlay.html
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: ExoAirPlayer
application.summary: ExoPlayer based media player with API for remote control.
application.desc:
Listens on the Wi-Fi LAN adapter using a stateless HTTP API (based on AirPlay v1). Advertises its availability for discovery using mDNS (Bonjour).
Supports devices of all display sizes; inexpensive generic set-top boxes with high-resolution HDMI output are the target platform, but works equally well on very old handsets with very small low-resolution screens.
The API is extensive and fully documented. A static web page SPA client implementation makes this functionality highly accessible. At its most basic level, this API provides the ability to "cast" media URLs into a playlist and control all aspects of playback.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: F-Droid
application.summary: The app store that respects freedom and privacy.
application.desc:
F-Droid is an installable catalogue of libre software apps for Android. The F-Droid client app makes it easy to browse, install, and keep track of updates on your device.
It connects to any F-Droid compatible repositories. The default repo is hosted at f-droid.org, which contains only bona fide libre software.
Android itself is open in the sense that you are free to install APKs from anywhere you wish, but there are many good reasons for using F-Droid as your libre software app manager:
● Get notified when updates are   available ● Optionally download and install   updates automatically ● Keep track of older and beta versions ● Filter out apps incompatible with the   device ● Find apps via categories and   searchable descriptions ● Access associated URLs for donations,   source code etc. ● Stay safe by checking repo index   signatures and APK hashes
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: F-Droid Basic
application.summary: The minimal client app for the app store that respects freedom and privacy.
application.desc:
NOTE: The Basic version of F-Droid Client has a reduced feature set (e.g. no nearby share and no panic feature). It targets Android 13 and can do unattended updates without privileged extension or root.
F-Droid is an installable catalogue of libre software apps for Android. The F-Droid client app makes it easy to browse, install, and keep track of updates on your device.
It connects to any F-Droid compatible repositories. The default repo is hosted at f-droid.org, which contains only bona fide libre software.
Android itself is open in the sense that you are free to install APKs from anywhere you wish, but there are many good reasons for using F-Droid as your libre software app manager:
● Get notified when updates are   available ● Optionally download and install   updates automatically ● Keep track of older and beta versions ● Filter out apps incompatible with the   device ● Find apps via categories and   searchable descriptions ● Access associated URLs for donations,   source code etc. ● Stay safe by checking repo index   signatures and APK hashes
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Httper
application.summary: Configure and send HTTP requests.
application.desc:
Configurable HTTP request attributes:
● method ● protocol ● URL ● headers ● querystring parameters ● body
Features include the ability to:
● send a request once ● send a request repeatedly at a   specified time interval ● reload the configuration of a prior   request from a history log ● pretty print JSON response data ● preview HTML response data
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Locale Changer
application.summary: Change the default Android system locale.
application.desc:
Displays a list of all available locales. Clicking on any list item changes the Android system locale to the selected value. Changes are persistent.
The currently active locale is always positioned as the first list item.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Mock my GPS
application.summary: Mock Android location providers: GPS, Network, Fused.
application.desc:
Features include the ability to:
● mock a fixed position ● simulate a trip ● use a joystick to move relative to a   mock fixed position ● accept latitude and longitude   geo-coordinate pairs from Intents ● save latitude and longitude   geo-coordinate pairs as named   bookmarks
Variations:
1. AOSP 2. AOSP + Google Play Services 3. AOSP + Huawei Mobile Services
Android integration:
1. enable Developer Options    ● open:        Settings > System > About phone    ● repeatedly click 7 times:        Build number 2. configure:    ● open:        Settings > System > Developer        Options    ● save values:        Mock location app: "Mock my GPS"
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Mock my GPS UnifiedNlp Backend
application.summary: Companion for "Mock my GPS". Backend plugin for "UnifiedNlp".
application.desc:
Allows "Mock my GPS" to behave as a mock location provider for "UnifiedNlp".
"UnifiedNlp" is:
● typically installed as a component of   "microG" ● intended for use on de-Googled Android   ROMs ● a drop-in replacement for "Google   Location Services"
"UnifiedNlp" integration of mock location data:
● is only enabled while "Mock my GPS" is   active ● is prioritized over other "UnifiedNlp"   backend plugins by advancing the   timestamp 45 seconds, so it appears to   be most recent
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: MyPlaces
application.summary: Reads GPX and KML files as lists of geographic coordinate bookmarks.
application.desc:
Features include the ability to:
● sort the list of geographic   coordinates:   ○ sequential       Ordered as the locations occur in       the input file.       ● ex: a precise travel itinerary   ○ distance       Ordered by distance from the       current location.       ● ex: ad-hoc exploration of nearby         POI   ○ alphabetic       Ordered by the descriptive names       associated with locations.       ● ex: bookmarks of favorite places ● click on a list item to open the   corresponding location in an external   application, such as mapping or   navigation.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Node.js Frontend
application.summary: Frontend to execute Node.js application from the Android filesystem.
application.desc:
Features include the ability to:
● configure and save any number of   application profiles ● each application profile can specify:   ○ title   ○ file path to main Javascript file   ○ command line options for the Node.js     runtime   ○ command line options for the     application   ○ environment variables   ○ current working directory ● application profiles are grouped by:   ○ "exec"       Applications share a single       process. Only one can execute at a       time.   ○ "fork"       Each application is given its own       process. Each executes in a       foreground service. An associated       notification kills the process. ● backup and restore:   ○ export all application profiles to     JSON   ○ import new application profiles from     JSON
Embedded runtime environment:
● Node.js 12.19.0 ● OpenSSL 1.1.1g
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: OneClipboard
application.summary: Client to synchronize clipboard data through a server.
application.desc:
Servers are available for a variety of platforms, including Android.
All clients that connect to a common server and authenticate using the same username and password combination will share a common clipboard. Whenever any client copies new data into its clipboard, this data is sent to the server and then broadcast to all authenticated clients.
All clipboard data is encrypted end-to-end.
Tasker integration is supported.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: OneClipboard Server
application.summary: Server to synchronize clipboard data across clients.
application.desc:
Clients are available for a variety of platforms, including Android.
All clients that connect to this server and authenticate using the same username and password combination will share a common clipboard. Whenever any client copies new data into its clipboard, this data is sent to the server and then broadcast to all authenticated clients.
All clipboard data is encrypted end-to-end.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: ProxyDroid
application.summary: Configure and manage network proxy servers.
application.desc:
Requires root!
Features include:
● support for proxy server protocols:   ○ HTTP   ○ HTTPS   ○ SOCKS4   ○ SOCKS5 ● support for authentication methods:   ○ Basic   ○ NTLM   ○ NTLMv2 ● support for enabling of proxy server:   ○ globally, for all apps   ○ only for specific apps ● support for a blacklist:   ○ IP addresses to bypass the proxy ● support for a DNS proxy ● support for multiple profiles ● basic support for a proxy   auto-configuration (PAC) file ● ability to associate a particular   profile with:   ○ WiFi SSID   ○ Mobile Network ● widget to toggle proxy on/off ● runtime efficiency:   ○ consumes little battery   ○ uses little RAM
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: PTT Bluetooth Speaker: Receiver
application.summary: Receives audio from the sender and plays it through the speaker.
application.desc:
Runs in a foreground Service:
● there is no visible UI ● makes the Bluetooth adapter   discoverable ● starts a Bluetooth Socket server ● listens for a connection from a sender
When a sender connects:
● stops listening for a sender   connection ● plays the audio stream from the   connected Socket
When a sender disconnects:
● resumes listening for a new sender   connection
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: PTT Bluetooth Speaker: Sender
application.summary: Captures audio from the microphone and sends it to the receiver.
application.desc:
Usage:
● displays a list of all paired   Bluetooth devices   ○ click the one that identifies the     desired receiver   ○ wait for connection
● toggle the PTT button   ○ green indicates that audio is     currently being captured     from the microphone and streamed     through the connected socket   ○ red indicates that the audio stream     is currently paused
● move the slider to adjust the volume   of the audio   ○ default: 25%   ○ maximum: 200%
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Root Script Runner
application.summary: Executes shell scripts as the root user.
application.desc:
Requires root!
Execution of a shell script can be invoked in two ways:
1. interactive      By the user manually choosing a      file. 2. automatic      By an Intent.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: RTSP IP-Cam Viewer
application.summary: Watch RTSP and RTMP video streams.
application.desc:
These formats are typical of inexpensive IP security cameras.
Features include the ability to:
● configure an unlimited number of video   streams ● import video streams from a JSON file ● each stream can include URLs for two   sources:   ○ low resolution   ○ high resolution ● selectively enable and disable streams   in the list ● display the enabled streams in either   a list or grid layout   ○ uses low resolution (when available) ● select a single stream from the list   or grid layout   ○ displays in full screen   ○ uses high resolution (when     available)
History:
This application was originally written to test an experimental branch of ExoPlayer. At the time, this branch had an open pull request that hadn't been merged after several years:   https://github.com/google/ExoPlayer/pull/3854
Eventually, this branch was merged. Now, this application uses a stable build of ExoPlayer. Which, imho, makes it less interesting. But it may still be useful.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Slideshow Screensaver
application.summary: Screensaver that displays a slideshow of local images.
application.desc:
Slideshow Settings:
● Time Duration (ms)     The period of time each image is     displayed. ● Use MediaStore provider     Obtains image files from Android     index. ● Directory path     Obtain images from a particular     directory in the filesystem. ● Recurse into subdirectories ● Random order
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: SMS Forwarding
application.summary: Inspect received SMS messages and conditionally forward them.
application.desc:
The conditions are defined by a list of rules. Each rule associates a forwarding recipient telephone number with a pattern that must match the sender of a received SMS message.
When a new SMS message is received, it is forwarded to recipient telephone numbers according to each rule having a matching pattern.
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: SMS my GPS
application.summary: Inspect received SMS messages and conditionally reply with GPS location data.
application.desc:
Conditional criteria include:
● a whitelist of sender phone numbers ● a substring that must occur at the   beginning of the received SMS message
GPS location data include:
● latitude and longitude coordinates ● accuracy (meters) ● speed (meters/sec) ● direction (cardinal or ordinal, and   degrees) ● URL to Google Maps
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: Tiny Television Time Tracker (TV Tracker)
application.summary: Track your favorite television series.
application.desc:
Features include the ability to:
● search for television series by name ● add television series in search   results to a list ● sort and filter the list of added   television series ● drill into the list to read detailed   information about each series and its   available episodes ● mark episodes as having been watched ● mark series as disabled ● associate each series with external   URLs   ○ ex: web sites where the series can     be watched ● update the television series in the   list   ○ to obtain information about new     episodes
Network requirements:
● the list of added television series   can be used while fully offline ● an internet connection is only needed   to manually add or update television   series
Credits:
● all data is obtained from The Movie   Database (TMDB), using version 3 of   the TMDB API ● historic lineage:   1. DroidSeries        https://github.com/pcabido/droidseries   2. DroidShows        https://github.com/ltguillaume/droidshows   3. Tiny Television Time Tracker
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: WebCast
application.summary: Light-weight web browser to extract video URLs from web sites.
application.desc:
Video URLs on the current web page are displayed in a list.
Settings determine the behavior when a video URL is selected: ● the internal video player includes a   Chromecast sender ● the external video player allows   another app to play the video URL ● the "ExoAirPlayer" and "HLS Proxy"   senders each load a static web page   SPA client for the chosen server
application.author: Warren R Bank

application.name: WebMonkey
application.summary: Light-weight web browser with support for Greasemonkey userscripts.
application.desc:
Features include:
● detection of userscript URLs ● automatic userscript updates ● an extended Javascript API to expose   Android specific capabilities ● the ability to ignore HTTPS   certificate errors
Limitations:
● userscripts only run in the top window   ○ script injection into iframes is     possible, but requires a complicated     workaround; refer to the README for     details.
application.author: Warren R Bank
